info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 2:28PM EDT until May 16 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Berks County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 228 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Myerstown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Kutztown, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Laureldale, Womelsdorf, Topton, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Lyons, Strausstown, Lenhartsville, Fairview Hgts and Centerport. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
